se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.api.trees.node

Interface MutableNode<K extends Comparable<K>,V>

  • Type Parameters:
    V - The value type of this MutableNode.
    K - The key type of this MutableNode.
    All Superinterfaces:
    Comparable<Node<K,V>>, Node<K,V>, Serializable

    public interface MutableNode<K extends Comparable<K>,V>
extends Node<K,V>
    Specification for a Node whose internal state can be manipulated, in terms of moving it within trees, and adding/removing children.
    Author:
    Lennart Jörelid, jGuru Europe AB

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addChild(MutableNode<K,V> node)
      Adds the provided node as a child to this MutableNode.
      void clearParent()
      Removes this MutableNode from its parent, by removing both the reference to the parent from this MutableNode and the reference from the parent MutableNode to this MutableNode (in its list of children).
      void removeChild(MutableNode<K,V> node)
      Removes the provided child node from this MutableNode, if it exists.
      void removeChildren(Filter<Node<K,V>> nodeFilter)
      Removes all immediate children of this MutableNode matching the provided Filter.
      void setParent(MutableNode<K,V> parent)
      Assigns the parent of this MutableNode.

      • Methods inherited from interface se.jguru.nazgul.core.algorithms.api.trees.node.Node

        getChildren, getData, getKey, getParent, getPath

      • Methods inherited from interface java.lang.Comparable

        compareTo

    • Method Detail

      • addChild

        void addChild(MutableNode<K,V> node)
       throws IllegalArgumentException
        Adds the provided node as a child to this MutableNode.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to add.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if the given node could not be added properly.

      • removeChildren

        void removeChildren(Filter<Node<K,V>> nodeFilter)
        Removes all immediate children of this MutableNode matching the provided Filter.
        Parameters:
        nodeFilter - a Filter defining which children should be removed.

      • removeChild

        void removeChild(MutableNode<K,V> node)
        Removes the provided child node from this MutableNode, if it exists. If the provided node is not a child node of this MutableNode, this method should return silently.
        Parameters:
        node - The node to remove.

      • setParent

        void setParent(MutableNode<K,V> parent)
        Assigns the parent of this MutableNode.
        Parameters:
        parent - The parent of this node.

      • clearParent

        void clearParent()
        Removes this MutableNode from its parent, by removing both the reference to the parent from this MutableNode and the reference from the parent MutableNode to this MutableNode (in its list of children).
